how can I make sure my removable media is mounted on boot?
Make an fstab entry for it.
by including it, will it automatically be mounted, or do I need to add a flag or something
I guess you're trying to make a removeable key so that the filesystem is only decrypted when that key is inserted?
yep. Unfortunately it's not my brilliant idea though
Do sudo blkid and pastebin that for me please, and tell me the mount point you want
I haven't gotten the removable media yet
Ah, well then you'll probably want to wait for that to set up mounting it then
as long as I don't add the noauto flag, it should mount automatically, yes?
Everything in fstab is mounted automatically. This should do you:      UUID="blah" /mount/point -t vfat -o ro,nouser,suid,uid=UID,gid=GID 0 0
Change vfat to the appropriate filesystem if it's not that, change UID and GID (capital parts) to the specific user's UID and GID, and change blah to the proper UUID when you have the drive set up
well, users can have their own passphrases on the drive as well, cant they? If you limit the UID and GID, then only one user can use it. In that case, shouldn't permission just be set
permissions on the files*. And what about if I wanted to add a passphrase because I had another file to add?
That would mount it read-only
Don't know about a passphrase to add another file, sudo might be able to override read-only though
